page.title: 04NATIONAL TRUST AND CRATHES
page.content: When the estate was in private hands more than{30}servants was employed. Today the{National Trust for Scotland} employs{12}full-time staff _ the warden, an administration assistant, 5 gardeners, 2 forest rangers and 3 foresters. During the summer months, some{40} part-time staff are employed as castle guides and in the{Visitors Centre} restaurant, shop and car parks. The{Visitors Centre}was opened in{1984 and completed in{1985.}It comprises of an{exhibition room,}with displays on local history and natural history, a{ {souvenir and craft shop}and a{licensed {restaurant. The local school,{Banchory Academy,} recently presented a contour model of the estate and it now forms the centrepiece of the{exhibition room.
